text:
is there a way to make F10 print out tilde in the REPL.

```import REPL
import REPL.LineEdit

const mykeys = Dict{Any,Any}(
    "F10" => "~",
)

function customize_keys(repl)
    repl.interface = REPL.setup_interface(repl; extra_repl_keymap = mykeys)
end

atreplinit(customize_keys)```
I edited this from the docs but I get

```UndefVarError: repl not defined
julia>```
on startup

elements.text: is there a way to make F10 print out tilde in the REPL.
I edited this from the docs but I get

text: Unrelated to your `UndefVarError`, but I don't think this is possible. Function keys (like F10) don't correspond to real characters (afaik), they're just handled by the operating system and I don't think they can be handled by terminal applications.

elements.text: , but I don't think this is possible. Function keys (like F10) don't correspond to real characters (afaik), they're just handled by the operating system and I don't think they can be handled by terminal applications.

text:
typing into the terminal it produces tilde but in julia REPL or Ipython REPL it doesn't

interestingly plain python REPL it works fine
